metaDescription: Stylish 2-bedroom bungalow in VistaBella Golf, San Miguel de Salinas. €375,000. Premium specification, 40% cheaper than Spanish islands. Perfect holiday home.
heroIntro: Imagine waking up to endless Mediterranean sunshine in your own private bungalow, nestled in the sought-after VistaBella Golf community of San Miguel de Salinas. This exquisitely designed 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow offers the ultimate Mediterranean escape—a sanctuary where holiday memories are made and cherished for years to come. With 92m² of thoughtfully appointed living space set on a 93m² plot, this property represents the pinnacle of Costa Blanca holiday home living without the premium island price tags. At €375,000, you're acquiring a sunshine retreat with premium specifications at 40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands like Ibiza and Mallorca. Whether you're seeking a peaceful getaway from northern winters, a base for exploring the Alicante coastline, or a smart second home investment, this bungalow delivers on every front. The VistaBella Golf location ensures tranquility while keeping you minutes from pristine beaches, championship golf courses, and vibrant Mediterranean culture.
areaSection: San Miguel de Salinas is a charming inland municipality in southern Alicante, perfectly positioned between the bustling Costa Blanca coast and the verdant interior landscape. This strategic location places you just 20 minutes from world-class Blue Flag beaches while maintaining the peaceful, authentic atmosphere of a Spanish village. The town enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine, with mild winters (rarely below 10°C) and warm summers tempered by Mediterranean breezes. VistaBella Golf sits within a well-established residential enclave known for its mature landscaping, quality construction standards, and strong sense of community. The area has seen consistent development and investment, reflected in the 8% year-on-year property price appreciation. San Miguel de Salinas attracts discerning buyers seeking authentic Spanish living combined with modern amenities and international accessibility.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in San Miguel de Salinas strikes the perfect balance between relaxation and convenience. The established expat community means English is widely spoken, with numerous restaurants, cafés, and services catering to international residents. Your mornings might begin with fresh coffee at a local café before browsing the weekly markets, where Spanish vendors sell produce at remarkable prices. The nearby Mercadona and Lidl supermarkets stock everything from Spanish delicacies to international brands. For afternoon adventure, several championship golf courses are within 15 minutes' drive, while multiple Blue Flag beaches offer swimming, water sports, and beachfront dining. The healthcare system is exceptional—English-speaking doctors staff private clinics, and the regional hospital is just 30 minutes away. International schools in the region provide excellent education options for families. The expat-friendly environment means finding English speakers for repairs, maintenance, and professional services is straightforward, while public buses connect you to larger towns. Yet despite these conveniences, the pace of life remains refreshingly unhurried.
investmentSection: San Miguel de Salinas demonstrates robust investment fundamentals with property prices appreciating 8% year-on-year, significantly outpacing inflation. This bungalow's premium specification justifies pricing 85% above the municipal average (€2,200/m² vs €4,076/m²), positioning it in the quality segment with strong rental potential. Holiday rentals in the area command €800 per week, generating approximately €38,000 annually on 48 weeks rental (accounting for personal use). Over a 5-year holding period, you could realistically expect both capital appreciation and consistent rental income. The Costa Blanca's established tourism infrastructure, combined with growing interest from Northern European investors seeking Mediterranean property, sustains demand. Unlike Spanish island markets—where €375,000 buys considerably less—this mainland location offers better value while maintaining year-round appeal to holiday renters and potential buyers seeking a permanent Mediterranean base.
conclusion: This 2-bedroom bungalow in VistaBella Golf represents more than just property—it's your gateway to the Mediterranean lifestyle you've imagined. At €375,000, you're acquiring a premium-specification holiday home and smart investment in one of Europe's most sought-after regions, at prices 40% below Spanish island markets. Whether you dream of escaping northern winters, establishing a revenue-generating holiday rental, or creating lasting memories with family and friends under endless Mediterranean sunshine, this bungalow delivers. The combination of location, quality, community, and value proposition creates a rare opportunity in today's Costa Blanca market. Don't let this exceptional property escape your reach. lifeAndAmenities.intro: San Miguel de Salinas offers exceptional convenience for residents seeking the Mediterranean lifestyle without sacrificing modern necessities. Healthcare, education, shopping, and transport are all accessible within minutes, creating a seamlessly integrated community experience.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in San Miguel de Salinas meets international standards with multiple access points. The regional hospital in Torrevieja (30 minutes) provides comprehensive emergency and specialist services, while several private clinics throughout the area offer rapid appointments with English-speaking doctors. Dental clinics, pharmacies, and health centers are conveniently distributed, ensuring routine care is never far away. Many healthcare providers accept European Health Insurance Cards, and private health insurance is affordable for expat residents. The Spanish healthcare system is ranked among Europe's finest, offering reliability and quality comparable to Northern Europe at significantly lower costs.

Spanish education is also available through public schools, providing cultural immersion opportunities. The region has successfully integrated international families for decades, creating established networks and support systems. Whether seeking continuity through British curriculum or embracing Spanish education, parents find quality options without difficulty.

shopping.text: Shopping convenience is exceptional in San Miguel de Salinas and surrounding areas. English-language shopping guides and apps help newcomers navigate local vendors and specialty shops catering to international residents.

The N-325 motorway provides quick connections to Alicante city, Valencia, and the wider region. For holiday visitors, car rental is inexpensive and booking simple. The excellent road infrastructure means beaches, restaurants, and attractions are easily accessible for day trips.

faqs.question: Ile kosztuje ta nieruchomość?
faqs.answer: €375,000. This 2-bedroom bungalow offers premium specifications in the sought-after VistaBella Golf community. The price represents exceptional value—40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands like Ibiza and Mallorca, while maintaining quality finishes and desirable location. Flexible payment options and mortgage arrangements are available for qualified buyers.

faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreigners have full rights to purchase property in Spain without restrictions or visa requirements. British citizens, EU nationals, Americans, Australians, and citizens of most countries can buy freely. The process is straightforward with proper legal representation, and many English-speaking solicitors specialize in international purchases. Non-resident buyers may face slightly different tax implications, but ownership rights are identical.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €375,000 purchase price, expect additional costs of approximately 8-10%: property transfer tax (typically 8%), legal fees (€800-1,500), notary fees (€400-600), and property registration fees (€200-300). Your solicitor will provide a detailed breakdown. Some costs vary by region and individual circumstances. For this property, total acquisition costs would be approximately €30,000-37,500 beyond the purchase price.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is remarkably economical compared to Northern Europe. Groceries cost 30-40% less than UK prices, restaurant meals range from €8-15 for quality dining, and utilities average €80-120 monthly. Property maintenance and services are similarly affordable. Many British residents report reducing living costs by 30-50% compared to equivalent UK lifestyles, making this an attractive retirement or semi-retirement destination.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes. Several Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign buyers. Terms typically range from 15-30 years at competitive rates. Most lenders require 20-30% down payment and proof of income. British buyers often find favorable rates through banks familiar with international clients. A Spanish mortgage broker can guide you through options—many speak English and understand international buyer circumstances.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca to dobre miejsce na zakup nieruchomości?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Costa Blanca combines affordability, lifestyle, healthcare quality, and investment potential that few European destinations match. Property prices appreciate steadily (8% year-on-year in San Miguel de Salinas), rental demand remains strong year-round, and the established expat community provides support systems. Whether for holiday home, investment, or permanent relocation, Costa Blanca offers exceptional value and quality of life.

faqs.question: Jaka jest pogoda na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Spectacular. Expect over 300 days of annual sunshine with mild winters (10-18°C) and warm summers (26-32°C) tempered by Mediterranean breezes. Rain is rare, concentrated in autumn and spring. The climate is ideal for year-round outdoor activities—beach swimming from May to October, and pleasant conditions for golf and exploration throughout winter. This weather consistency makes it perfect for holiday home ownership.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca jest dobra dla emerytów?
faqs.answer: Excellent choice for retirees. The combination of affordable living costs, exceptional healthcare, Mediterranean climate, established expat communities, and vibrant social networks make Costa Blanca increasingly popular with UK and Northern European retirees. Many find they can live comfortably on modest pensions while enjoying superior weather, healthcare, and leisure activities compared to home countries.

faqs.question: Jak daleko jest Costa Blanca od Polski?
faqs.answer: Approximately 1,200 km (750 miles) from London. Alicante-Elche Airport, 45 minutes from this property, offers multiple daily flights to UK destinations—typically 2.5-3 hour flight time. Budget airlines provide competitive fares, making frequent visits home very feasible for holiday home owners. Many property owners maintain schedules allowing UK visits every 6-8 weeks.

faqs.question: What rental income potential exists for this bungalow?
faqs.answer: Significant. Holiday rentals in San Miguel de Salinas command approximately €800 per week, generating roughly €38,000 annually across 48 weeks (accounting for personal use and maintenance gaps). Professional property management services handle bookings, cleaning, and guest coordination for 30-40% of rental income. Even modest utilization generates €15,000-20,000 annually, providing partial offset to ownership costs.
